Great place to grab brunch on the weekend. its crowded, noise level is high, tables are cramped together to make space for as many people as possible.. but hey - all you need on the weekend is a good serving of eggs and coffee.. they do a great job at it. their burger is pretty good as well. so give it a try - you wont be disappointed.

Had the roast beef sandwich and French onion soup. The food was delicious and the soup was to die for. The sauce on the sandwich was a bit much and made it hard to hold and fall apart needing a fork :(

Great brunch! Took my visiting family here a few weeks ago and everybody loved it.  It's a nice place to spend an afternoon.  Food is always well prepared and the staff is pleasant.  Love the ceiling in the dining room.

I came here on a Sunday for brunch and waited about 40 minutes to be seated. It's a lovely brunch experience if you sit outside. This place is cute and has flowers and green umbrellas adorning the outside dining area. I ordered steak and eggs (will done) & though the steak was ok, the eggs were practically raw to the point where I sent them back. They came back & still weren't well done. Not cool. The mimosas were pretty good but above average. The service was mediocre.

Nice trendy, upscale diner type.  The only one of its kind that I've come across so far in Hoboken.  Portions are smaller than a traditional NJ diner which I prefer and am okay with.  Food is fresh, high quality and made well.  I enjoy pretty much everything on the menu.  Good place, have been here 5 times in as many months and plan on coming back regularly.
Elysian is a must in Hoboken!  The outdoor cafe has a true Parisian feel. Get the Caesar salad!  It is top notch; perfect with grilled shrimp or served next to the vegetable or pulled-pork sandwich.

When you get older, you realize that sometimes, an establishment should be judged on atmosphere, service, food quality and decor versus how cheap the beers are.5 stars when it comes to atmosphere, service, food quality and decor.5 stars for the oysters, mussels and beer options.5 stars for a 'boken resto/bar?  Yes, 5 stars.

I have eaten at Elysian for both dinner and brunch and while both are good, brunch is not to be missed. Life changing french toast, strong bloody marys and a well made cappuccino. Monday nights are also a good option for their buy one get one free bar menu special.

This is the place I bring friends who have never been to Hoboken. Especially when the weather is nice and you can sit outside to eat, there is no better place to go! They are very dog friendly and it's nice to have a place where the puppy can sit and people watch while you eat!I never eat fish, but the Pan Roasted Salmon here is so amazing and unbelievably well cooked EVERY single time. I have seriously never been disappointed by this place. I have probably ordered it 15+ times and it gets better every time. The potato leek cake and spinach it comes with are also fantastic.On one occasion I did stop here for brunch and had the egg white omelet. It was just one of the best omelets I have ever had! This place can do no wrong in my book! The Monday night special (Buy one get one free for bar entrees) is such a great deal, if only the salmon were on the bar menu!

We came here for brunch the other day with a few friends. The patio space is beautiful and was such a wonderful place to sit in the shade and sip a mimosa on a hot morning.  The breakfast food was delicious - my smoked salmon eggs benedict was so delicious and was only $11 or so?  Pretty reasonable for brunch.  The pommes frites were excellent, but I also tried the other style of potatoes and was not impressed (soggy and flavorless).  They were very accomodating in changing out "starch" for a salad or fruit for our friends. The waitstaff were prompt, friendly and not pushy to get us to leave.  They let us sit and chat and enjoy our time with our friends well after we were done eating, which is what brunch is for!

If you feel like you need to catch up on some juicy Hoboken gossip, grab a seat outside at the Elysian Cafe and just sit back and enjoy.  Once it warms up again, my dog and I are going to be regulars.  I absolutely love this place.  For brunch, you get a very decent meal at very affordable prices.  And $3.50 mimosas.  {Yes, that deserves a sentence in itself.}  Dinner is a bit on the pricier side unless you are ordering from the bar menu, but the meals are very enjoyable.One note I must make is about the fries....or in French terms, "pommes frites."  I generally try to avoid fried foods and order a side salad instead; I would much rather indulge in dessert than chow down on some fried cheese balls, onion rings, etc.  However, these fries are irresistible.  I think it's because they are so thin and served piping hot- not the typical steak fries that you get served cold and soggy at some other establishments.   Plan on heading to the gym if you must, but don't skip out on the pommes frites!

A friend, who I affectionately know as Nurse Kate, was kind enough to lead me here after a night out in No-jokin' Hoboken. This little spot is not short on charm by any means. We were seated near the bar, and on a hot summer's day on the East Coast, the AC allowed us to breath easy for a bit. I was very happy with my Eggs Benedict, my brunch staple, and the pommes fritz were a nice little addition, although they seemed a bit much for this early in the day. You can't go wrong with an Art Deco bar and tiny cafe tables-- it just takes you back to a time long ago when brunch really was an occasion. Loved the wait staff, and the story behind the cafe that gives it that very specific charm that you find all over Hoboken. I'll be back the next time I come to raise the roof on the East Side.

I would rate it a 4 star really. Stopped by for brunch today and loved the lobster roll and eggs. Nice ambience and friendly service. Also wish we could have sat outside, but it was too windy. Took a star off for the DUMB HOSTESS, who told us it would be a 25 minute wait, even while we saw a couple of empty tables. When I pointed out the empty tables to her, she said that we could sit there and we did right away. Isn't it her job to know which tables are available? The place may be losing business thanks to this hostess

This place has the best service in Hoboken, hands down. I first ate brunch here 3 years ago while shopping around for Condo's and remember being pleasantly surprised. After a long hiatus (for reasons I cannot explain) we went back on Fri night for dinner. Holy $#!t does this place work like a well oiled machine. We started our meal with a few kumamoto oysters and the "maryland" style crab cake. The oysters were fresh and tasty, and the crab cake, although not a true lump crab cake was very, very tasty. With our apps we had a few drinks. I'm not sure what my GF got, but it had something to do with Grey Goose Pear and a lemon twist - it was almost too refreshing (I would drink 100 of them), and I had a Makers Mark Manhattan - it was very well made. Moving on to dinner - We both had glasses of the Code du Rhone Merlot. My GF got the braised beef short rib. It was cooked to perfection and spiced very well. The presentation of the dish was excellent, making it both visually and taste pleasing. I got the brined pork chop. Man was it cooked to perfection, and HUGE to. The taste from the brine was outstanding, and the brussel sprouts were like crack... Seriously, I don't even like brussel sprouts.For desert we had the mint chocolate chip sundae, which was insane, needless to say.Seriously though it was beyond the food that made this place. It just has all the right attributes. You walk in to a dimly lit dining room with a long, fully packed bar. As you pass through the front room into the back you get a completely different atmosphere from the front. And I don't mean that in a bad way. The floor is covered in vintage black and white bathroom tile, and the ceiling has the most intricate patterns that just compliment the structure. You feel like you've been tossed back to the 20s. On top of all of this, as soon as you sit down they bring you water. I know you're all thinking that's not impressive, but if you live in Hoboken you understand that there is more mediocre service here than anything, and sometimes getting glasses of water is a task in itself. The waiter was knowledgable of the menu and gave good recommendations, and the staff were super friendly and efficient - making sure we didn't sit in our own filth. I cannot stress enough how much you need to check this place out. Just go already

This is my favorite place in Hoboken, period. I eat and/or drink there at least once a week. We've been there 3 times within a 24 hour period on numerous occasions. I should start checking in, I'd be the mayor (errr, I mean duke) in a week. We mostly come for drinks, usually late night after the dinner crowd has left.  They have a great rotating selection of beers on tap, and Doug is the best bartender in Hoboken.  The food is great. Brunch is probably better than dinner, but I've always been happy with whatever I order. My favorite is the calamari salad.  But most importantly, and what keeps me coming back, is the people there. It's fair to say I'm a regular, so I may be bias. But I think a good barometer of a local restaurant is how they treat their regulars, even if I'm not one. And Elysian treats their regulars with service and friendliness that I've never experienced at another restaurant or bar. But never at the expense of their other patrons. I can't give this place enough stars. I'll be there tonight. And tomorrow...

This is a bar and a  mediocre French bistro. Came here for dinner on a Friday night, it was busy just like most of other restaurants in town. We sat in the middle of the back room at a small patio size table among a more matured crowd. I ordered the seafood special shrimp with creamy polenta, with water melon chopped up on the top, it was good but not great, the polenta got boring quick. My date had the Chipotle Thyme Marinated Skirt Steak, a generous portion, but the risotto needed more cooking. The highlight was the Double Chocolate Sundae. the coffee was low diner quality, almost as bad as the ones Citi offers at work. Others say this place has great brunch so we might be back to try it on the weekend, but for dinner you could find better spots.

I came here for dinner several times and I started off the review with 3 stars, but I think I have to downgrade to 2.  I'll explain why in a little bit.For the most part, food is consistent, although there were a few hiccups.  There isn't a wide selection, but I always end up settling on something.  The crispy calamari salad was disappointing.  Soggy and oily calamari.  The grilled veg sandwich is fantastic.  I absolutely love their french fries (pommes frites)!This isn't the prettiest looking place inside.  It is dying for a renovation.  I had a 1 year old with me and they were accomodating.  There are always people dining here.Had a crepe du jour for lunch once.  It was BBQ chix.  When I received it, it was room temp and it just tasted and looked like leftovers from the night before.  I'm not saying it was leftovers, but I couldn't help but think that based on the way it was presented.  And why was there melted cheddar cheese on it?  During the same lunch, the bar manager or restaurant manager sat down right next to me while she was making the employee schedule and eating HER lunch.  She was constantly talking to the bartenders as well.  I felt like I was intruding and eating in her office.   Managers should NOT be eating next to patrons.  Period.While I had gone about 3 times up to that horrible lunch, now I won't go back.  It's just not worth it.  I'd rather go elsewhere.

I went here for brunch yesterday with a friend, and I had a great experience. It would have been a 20-minute wait for a table, so we decided to just sit at the bar. The bartender, Doug, was great, and the food was drinks and food were, too. We each had mimosas (Only $3.75 for a glass, not a flute? When are things ever that affordable in the NYC area?) and the egg white omelet. I prefer when the ingredients are mixed into the egg, but the goat cheese, spinach and tomatoes made for a yummy meal, and the potatoes were good, too. Almost more importantly than the food, however, was the atmosphere. The Elysian has really great charm, and the service was great. I'll definitely be back!

As a restaurant, I would say that the food is so-so and the prices are not really justified.  The place seems to have an attitude vibe as well, from customers and staff, hard to describe, but you just feel it. Salmon- so/so, steak/frittes- so/so. And these two entrees go for about 50 dollars total, so a few drinks and apps and you have a pricey dinner. Years ago, this used to be a pretty cool bar with live blues music. It's changed a lot.

This is a rock solid restaurant.  Frankly, Hoboken could use a few more just like it. By way of background, I had been to Elysian on several occasions for brunch and, while it was good, it never left a lasting impression.  This 4-star review is for their dinner service.  We started with the mussels in white wine and also shared a bruschetta pizza.  Both were on-point and are highly recommended.  For my main, I had the sliced steak sandwich which I absolutely loved.  I also tried a few bites of cod which was cooked to perfection and very enjoyable.  I liked everything about my experience, from the food, to my martini to the service (attentive without being intrusive).  Overall, it is the perfect place to go when you are looking for a great meal without the pretension or high prices you might expect for food of this quality.

Mostly all of the reviews of this place are on the money.  Great service and atmosphere combined with a wonderful selection of food.  This place is in!  I can't wait till it gets nice out and they have tables.  I will be holding court with my 2 french bulldogs at my side.

Nice atmosphere, though a bit too crowded and close for my comfort.  The menu on a Saturday morning was only brunch -- and fairly limited.  My omelet was okay -- nothing special.  The spinach it came with was also okay, though a bit salty.  If you're up for brunch it's certainly okay -- but I would not make a special trip -- except maybe to view the copious old photos on the wall.

I don't think I've ever been disappointed here. This includes the best meal I had the week Sandy left Hoboken without power (and sanity). During day 4 of no electricity and room temperature food, enough was enough. Trekking out in the dark, we stumbled upon Elysian - one of the only restaurants still serving a hot meal. We were seated in the main dining room (lit by candles - hello mood lighting). The waitress was apologetic that all they had was stuffed rigatoni with red sauce as if it would be the worst thing we could possibly eat. Let me tell you - that meal was the highlight of my week. I got my first hot meal AND a glass of wine (or two) in 4 days! The huge plate of pasta and wine was $5 each. It was cheaper and better than some of the date nights I've had. I meant to send them a Christmas card thanking them for their hospitality and warm atmosphere during that week, but I forgot to (oops!) - I'll just leave them a stellar review here instead. I've had the skirt steak, braised beef short ribs, cheese plate and steak au poivre - all which I would recommend to a friend. They've consistently had great service and food. It's nice to know that such a reliable establishment is just a stone's throw away.

We had lunch here yesterday and it was a total accumulation of errors.First my lunch guest ordered the samon sandwich along with salad and the server only put in an order for 1/2 sandwich. Not sure why.When we asked for the other half, it did not come out right away and when we realized how long it was taking we asked the server to make the half to go since we no longer wanted it due to the time factor it took.We ordered unsweetened Iced tea and asked for a refill. The server had already put our bill on the table and pulled it back once we asked for a refill to add the request to the bill.  I am not sure if this is their policy to charge for refills, but we went along with it.   When the ice tea came back, it was sweetened and at that time we told the server to remove it from our bill to adjust the charge for the second Iced tea.  The server took the bill back.  It came back and I had a gift card in the amount of $100.00 that I was using to pay.  The bill came to $28.36 and I gave the server the gift card along with the bill and advised her she needed to remove the $2.50 charge.  She said she would take care of it.When the server came back, she had my gift card all written on with her figures on how much to write back on the gift card as my final balance. We wondered why she did write the math right on this Gift card  and not figure it out on a separate piece of paper.  The server came back and we noticed the Extra charge for the $2.50 was not taken off.  She insisted to us it was and she stood on that.  I asked her to look my orig bill before the $2.50  charge was taken off and look at the total left on my gift card   and the gift card balance showed the full amount taken off which included the iced tea we sent back.  She again insisted she took it The amount off and went back inside and came out with a slip which looked like a credit in the amount of $2.68 (I assume tax added back)  I told her that was ok, but show me on the Gift card where you gave this back to me.  She could not explain any further or did not understand so I asked for the Manager.   In a few minutes the manager showed up and we explained the situation and he understood and apologized for the issue and he would take care of it.  the manager came back and all they did was to remove the $2.50 charge and issue me a new gift card with the balance remanding.The bottom line is....bad service and a the servers understanding the requests.and getting food and drink order wrong

Elysian has been on my Hoboken "restaurant list" for quite some time now, so when the opportunity to have brunch here came up, I jumped on it. We went on a very hot day and opted to sit inside in the air conditioning. We were seated across from the bar with a very narrow walkway between the table and the bar. We felt like we were on top of the people next to us, and my boyfriend had to keep moving his chair anytime someone wanted to get by. It definitely ruined the experience a little. Now, onto the food and drinks. I ordered a bellini. It was really small and had an odd aftertaste. I ordered the egg white omelet for my meal. It was excellent! It definitely made up for the drink and odd seating arrangement. My boyfriend felt the same way about his chicken sandwich.I would like to give Elysian another try for their dinner, and hopefully we won't be seated in the bar area next time!

Elysian is one of those "go-to" neighborhood spots.  Its easy and convenient and the food is good to very good most of the time.  The bartenders in particular are very good especially Tommy.  The outdoor seating is great.Stand out items include the calamari salad, cod with basil risotto, and fish tacos.  Brunch is just Ok but pretty cheap compared to other Hoboken spots so bonus there.

Headed into the Elysian for a late lunch today. I was really impressed with atmosphere and the history (even if they're embellishing a bit). This is definitely a cool spot to check out if you want to take someone or meet a group some place interesting in Hoboken. The food is just ok - Chicken sandwich w/ fries and the Spaghetti Bolognese I tried was just average. Worth trying though - service was spot on.

Exactly what we were looking for! We were in Hoboken for the afternoon so we strolled the main drag and decided this spot looked promising. What a great find! The best BLT I've ever had - thick bacon with little fat, roasted tomatoes, avocado and presented stacked with piping hot and crispy fries in a rustic metal cup. Totally enjoyed with a Stella on tap. Friendly service - all was just right!

I went for mother's day and had an amazing time. Even though we were super late for our reservation, they were really cool about it. The decor and our waiter was pretty cute. My salmon with sauteed spinach was cooked perfectly. I believe it's the perfect first date place. Now all I have to do is find a date..

Shocked I haven't dropped a review on here yet, but in listing the town's best bloody mary, I couldn't leave Elysian out of the mix!  Great brunch with delicious pancakes, french toast, fresh fruit...everything is excellent, but the companion drink for $3.50 is a great deal and a great way to start the morning.Lunch/dinner never dissapoints with a great French/American menu, solid service, and sometimes even live music.  Any time of day, this is a classic place with great outdoor seating that will never let you down.

Overall, the food was good and the service was fine. Would totally have gone back and gave it 3-4 stars.  However, while sitting outside I noticed a fly in my beer I was drinking. I told the server and he got me a new beer. When the check came the beer that had the fly on it was on the check. I thought it was a mistake but he said it was not but he would get the manager. I have been to plenty of outdoor bars and I would always get a comp beer if a fly was in it. The manager came as was extremely rude. He told me that I was sitting in nature and that he could not control if a fly went into my beer. The way he talked down to me was unacceptable. he could have much better explained the situation instead of just telling me that "it is nature".  As a result I will never go back to the restaurant not because they would not comp me the beer but rather, the rudeness of the manager.

Hit up this place for brunch and the pomme frites does not disappoint! Has a nice outdoor cafe section which is perfect for summer/spring dining. Do yourself a favor and hit up this joint too. You may find me eating next to you!

Elysian Cafe is our go-to lunch/brunch/dinner spot in Hoboken.  Why? Food is always consistently fabulous, you don't need reservations, and it has a casual but hip vibe.  Without a question during the summer you must dine al fresco on their patio.  I have tried just about everything on the menu, but my favorite dish is the Caesar salad with grilled shrimp.  The dish is large enough to share, is perfectly dressed and comes with a healthy portion of jumbo grilled shrimp and two anchovies.  One of Hoboken's bests - highly recommend!

Very overrated and overpriced as a restaurant, but probably okay as a bar with food.We ate outside and the waiter kept going missing or messing things up. The food was only okay, and there was part of lobster shell left in the lobster sandwich. I was lucky not to choke. When i showed it, they offered a free dessert, though we were not planning on dessert.Friends tell me Amanda's is the place to eat, while Elysian is for the bar, and they are owned by the same people. My experience is that they are right that Elysian is not somewhere for fine dining, though they try to charge those kinds of prices.
Slow service. Staffs are unfrieny and even racist. Ordered 2 draft beer and took 10 minutes.  Never go there.  You will be disappointed for sure.

I've been here 3 times and really wanted to like it.  The service has never been more than mediocre and I've never left happy with my entree choice.  There are too many restaurants in Hoboken to settle here for dinner.On the upside: when its nice out, their outdoor seating is great.

I came with my wife and son for brunch..wait was about fifteen minutes..not bad..it was packed..waited for an hour for our food..my steak on my steak and eggs were overcooked..i expected more from this restaurant...smh
It looked as though this place was going to be crazy getting into, but I got a seat in less than a minute. Great atmosphere, music, staff, and food!
Cute little spot with outdoor seating that is perfect in the summer. Well priced wine list with a few great rose options. Enjoyed the short rib entree. Would definitely return.

This review is a two'fer.  First brunch, then dinner.Brunch:  Went here a few weeks ago for brunch and forgot to write a review.  Got an omelet (i forget what it was, but it was fancy.  I think goat cheese was involved) and homefries.  Both were fantastic, although I feel like they kind of skimped on the potatoes.Dinner:  Amazing.  I got the mussels with fries for $14 from the bar menu.  They were fantastic.  I will be going again soon to get more.  The fries here are absolutely fantastic.  I don't know what they do to them, but they are great.  The mussels were also phenomenal and some of the best I have.  Did I mention how great the fries are here?

Lived in Hoboken (1st and Garden) for 5 years, and because I was unwilling to schlep my lazy behind a measly 9 blocks uptown...I missed out on a solid go-to dinner spot for those "nicer than casual" but "not too stuffy" occassions.Elysian has an old-world feel to it in an authentically cozy (not antiquated) way.  Upon further research, this place was originally built as a bar/restaurant in 1895, and then turned into an ice cream parlor during prohibition.  Seems like quite the transition...kind of like the direct opposite of Bob Saget's career.  I did dinner here on a Thursday night.  The shrimp romesco appetizer was tasty, if not unspectacular - 4 big shrimp for $12.  The grilled sirloin salad (a bargain at $16) was over-sized and delicious.  But then again, I think nearly anything with spiced pecans is delicious (that goes for carmelized walnuts as well).The service was very attentive and friendly.  When my Italian friend (read: talks with hands flailing everywhere) knocked her glass of Prosecco over, our waiter was quick to clean off the table, put down a new table sheet, and cracked a few jokes at her expense (to which I laughed harder than I should've).  Biggest drawback is the acoustics.  You can clearly hear conversations going on 3-4 tables over.  So save your raunchy game of Truth or Dare for your next destination.

A neighborhood stalwart.  Good food on the bar menu (which you can order anywhere).I recommend going on a Monday night where you can get 2 for 1.Skip steak night on Wednesday- meat was tough.My lady really likes the cocktails and the fried calamari salad.
While you wont get anything new and exciting at Elysian, the food is consistent and well priced. I have been here many times and would go back anytime.

Pat yourself on the back Elysian Cafe you just earned yourself a spot at the top of the famous "Gems of Hoboken" list!  The food here was great, the service was snappy, the decor is awesome and its the oldest restaurant in Hoboken.  My gf and I split the mussels and smoked salmon club from the bar menu and both were banging.  I was not very impressed by the pomme frites though, they taste exactly like McDonald's fries (which are great, but not what I want when I am looking forward to pomme frites). Definitely check out Elysian Cafe if you have the chance!

I had been dying to try Elysian Cafe out for a while so when the opportunity to head to brunch came up I couldn't turn it down. I think the selling point for this restaurant is its  outside seating. Yes, plenty of places have outdoor seating but there'r something different about this place. Maybe its all the greenery I don't know. I wasn't overly impressed with the menu. It didn't seem overly "french" to me but overall my meal was good and priced well. Happy to go back but what french place doesn't have escargot on the menu? I mean really though.

I love this place. Walked by it a thousand times without ever coming in, I regret it now. Very interesting interior design, antique ceiling. Casual, great atmosphere with nice music in the background. Their portions are huge, so be prepared. But food is delicious, so I am sure you will be more than happy with portion sizes. For the appetizer we ordered their Mussels in white wine sauce, and I think they beat any mussels I tried before, or after for that matter! Make sure to ask them for a spoon, because you sure would want to drink that white wine sauce! 1 portion is good for 2 people. For the mains, I ordered their crispy calamari salad, and my brother ordered their famous Pastrami Reuben. I enjoyed my salad very much, but once I tried Pastrami Reuben I was simply blown away. Juicy, tender, flavourful and absolutely delicious! A must try for pastrami fans! It is a little too crowded, but I guess that speaks of the quality of their food =) Overall, a great experience!
Great outdoor patio and brunch. Service always pleasant.  Pomme frites very tasty.  Food overall is just above ok.

Worst customer service, even called the manager to go over a bad experience he never called me back after he said he would follow up. Hostess is in her own world, cramped seating and the most overlooked bland menu in town makes Little Town look like the Lambs Club. Never coming back again.

I can only speak about brunch, which is awesome with very cheap drinks and food, eggs Benedict are $10 which include French fries. I also tried the amaretto French toast very good! Service is slow but I don't mind. The cafe is one of the prettiest I have seen, read the story on the back of the menu

By far, my favorite brunch place in Hoboken.  Their food is great for a Saturday or Sunday brunch, especially in the summer/warm weather because they have a fabulous outdoor seating area.  Their brunch menu has both breakfast and lunch selections and their bellinis/blood marys/mimosas are all around the $4 range.  Who could ask for more?I've never been here for dinner, but I've heard it's good.

I enjoyed a lovely brunch here with my husband and one of our best friends last week. While they don't have an extensive menu, they had a good variety of choices in their brunch menu that will satisfy someone looking for either breakfast food or a lunch dish. My chicken sandwich was excellent. The service was good,  and the wait wasn't too long, even though it was really busy. Also, the menu items are very reasonbly priced. I would recommend this place for a nice lunch in Hoboken.

Sooo....from the outside it is super cute and inviting! I would definitely go back to enjoy a glass of wine (& maybe an appetizer) outside in the patio. The food was good but nothing to rave about. I got the smoked salmon club and not impressed. Also had the mint chocolate chip sundae with Oreos and it was good, but not $8 worth of goodness. So in the end- would i revisit? Short answer, yes but only for a drink and maybe app.

Awesome brunch! Very cute little cafe on the main drag in Hoboken... Close proximity to the water/NYC view and lots of window shopping nearby. I had the eggs florentine with french fries and a bloody mary & my friend had the eggs benedict with roast potatoes and a mimosa. Everything was fantastic!!! And sooo inexpensive for the area. I will def go back!

Was on my way to Max's up the block. Just note they are not open for lunch. Thank God this place was and I was pleasantly surprised. American fare with a French touch. Ate outside to welcome the spring feel. Imagine a cross between Paris and Hoboken. Perfect way to describe the feel. This is place is away from the hustle and bustle of lower Washngton St. so eating near the street was very peaceful. Food was impeccable, sipped wine like a hipster Hobokener should. Man what a way to relax. Great service, reasonable prices for lunch. Can't name a single flaw. This will be one of my favorite chill spots.

Come here for lunch frequently and love the grilled chicken sandwich with side salad. Have never ordered anything different so can't comment on that. Service is usually pretty good and like the decor. Being able to sit outside on nice days is also a major plus. Look forward to coming back again for yet another chicken......yes, i am boring.....but content.

This is possibly the cutest French bistro in Hudson County!  And the food is great too!Very welcoming and while from the outside it looks like a brunch place, it's great for any time of day: enjoy a early afternoon cocktail outside on a lazy day; get a draft beer at the bar while waiting for friends; eat lunch, brunch or dinner in either of the rooms; or simply enjoy a cocktail and an app in the main room while reading a magazine at 4pm.  Soak in the Frenchness!Portions were perfect: not too big and not pretentiously small.  True to the French bistro discipline, you will not be disappointed.  Wine is served in 6 ounce, 8 ounce or 75cl bottle sizes.

Came here a few weeks ago with my boyfriend on a friday night.  we didnt have a reservation and we were able to be seated within 5 minutes.  It was packed, and now i  know why! The muscles were fantastic and My bofriend loved his salmon.  The bruschetta pizza wasnt to brag about but now i know what to order there. My bloody mary hit the spot too! Every friday there is a live band and i have to say the guy we saw was great! definitely sit in the dining area, great lighting and vibe.

Great local establishment with a gorgeous ceiling! The staff is friendly and the food is right on! Extraordinary chicken club sandwich and side salad with fennel.  Really love the decor and "everyone knows your name" atmosphere!

MUST GO PLACE...  My family love love love this place.  Love the the historical decor, the service, atmosphere and the food is DELICIOUS.  Love eating inside and outside on a spring morning.  Great place to have mimosas with the girls for brunch.

This is one of my most favorite places to make plans to go for brunch in Hoboken! Every thing on the menu is very good and the ambiance is very classy, but not too pricey.Every one of my friends I have taken to brunch here all remember Elysian Cafe as the go-to place for brunch in this city!

So I love this place for it's architecture with opulant crown molding, gorgeous wood bar, subtle lighting. I'm not very keen on the crowd of undiverse young professionals, so I'll sneak in on a weekday early evening, order my lobster roll & garlic fries. With a meal that delicious, I can eat with a friend of mine and we'll mutually gorge w/ buttery rolls, arugula, a rib eye or some rich mussels. This is my usual routine and I like it best when the restaurant is low key, low pretention. The food is fancy enough, the service is thoughtfully quick and the over all tone can be obnoxious with questionable live music or with easy jazz in the background. Don't expect a diverse clientele, as Hoboken is limited in that arena especially for this price range. Food is solid and tastes better when you bring solid company. The wallet will stretch, but the portions, extensive bar menu, and service ease your spending just a little bit.
Nice place for brunch. Menu is fairly limited, but the food is excellent.

Went here for dinner with some family, and it was a good choice (especially cause it's a little pricey). This place would probably get 5 stars if it was a little cheaper.I got the steak and fries, and dear god was that a phenomenal decision. I ordered the steak medium - probably got it closer to medium well  - and it was very, very tasty. The steak juices dripping all over the fries made the fries taste just that much better.I'll come back, but I'll come back during one of their happy hours. If I'm not mistaken, I think it's 2 for 1 meals on Monday nights at the bar. That's a good deal for a place as good as this.

One of our favorite places in Hoboken, we do live 2 blocks away!  This place is gorgeous and has a lot of character.  The service is pretty good.  It definitely depends on who is bartending as to what type of service you get.  Some people just want to be there more than others!  Food is always very good, I recommend the vegetable sandwich!  The outside seats are great for warmer months!

This place has become our neighborhood "go-to" spot. The food is excellent and the service is usually very good. I definitely recommend the burger, but I have not ordered anything that was not very good. The garlic fries are amazing, as is the steak au-poivre.

Ate here for dinner in the back room. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was really cozy. Overall great experience. There entrees are a little pricer but well worth it but they also have a nice bar menu with gourmet burgers and sandwiches that are more reasonably priced.

I attended the whisky tasting last night. Our table was in complete agreement that it was a great evening. The food pairings were spot-on, service was impeccable and the presenter was fantastic. The atmosphere was lively and fun. The timing of the courses was perfect. Can't wait for the Brooklyn beer tasting and the Tequila Dinner.If you're in Hoboken and want to avoid the crowds of 20-somethings, this is the place to go.

great quality food, full bar, beautiful outdoor seating (and indoor for that matter).  loads of menu options and daily specials.  probably one of the most reliable spots in hoboken- this is where i take my mom when she's visiting- she swears by the short ribs.although food isn't michelin quality by any means, the simple menu options are elevated, tasty, and nicely portioned.  the theme is french bistro/ brasserie but hobokenized.  for example, don't expect a real croque monsieur, expect a grilled cheese with ham.  anyway- still good.  drinks are good, too.  as far as service, competent, yet blase for the most-part.

I've been to Elysian twice for brunch, once with my food loving boyfriend and the other time with my two food aficionado friends.  Both times were enjoyable.  They have a great outdoor seating area, with cute flowers and tables.  The service has always been friendly and quite attentive.  They serve water in recycled glass bottles and poor them into smaller glasses.  I'm a sucker for things like that.On to the food.  I have gotten the eggs florentine and fromage omelet, both with a side of pommes frittes (included in the dish).  I have no complaints! The pomme frittes come in a cute tin on your plate and the eggs have been cooked well each time.  I'm not a fan of hollaindaise sauce, and they made sure to not include it (sometimes people forget about sauce and dressings and it's always sad to have to ask them to re-make).  They open at 10am on Sundays and seem to get pretty busy after 11 or so.  Definitely head up there for the early rush!

After walking past this place for a few years I finally went in for brunch. What the heck was I waiting for? The eggs florentine are so good. Since then I  have never been disappointed anytime I have gone back. They also have a good selection of beer. The actual space is really beautiful and has a lot to look at though sometimes a little small and cramped near the bar.

This is a beautiful restaurant, with a great outdoors seating area. While the food isn't the real selling point, the bar food tends to be best--their sandwiches and burgers are delicious. On a hot evening in Hoboken, looking out on Washington St., this is the place to eat!

Update May 2013, we have been coming for a few years now I can say the food is consistently good.  The wait staff pretty much the same.  We did have a waiter who should not be in contact with the public and most likely was doing this as a part time gig while going to school. He had an attitude straight away.  After giving us the wine list, proceeded to stand their while we made our choice.  Who doe this?  The bus boy, Anthony, was far more attentive so I made sure I handed him a tip. All in all, I will continue to come but always know that the experience can be affected by one mediocre server. I have returned to Elysian Cafe to see if my second experience will be as good as my first. Well, YES! Started with Cote du Rhone bottle of red that is fabulous, appetizer of calamari in a salad that I just can't tell you how delicious. Fried calamari can be easily ruined, they managed to create a masterpiece salad, served with dandelion, Parmesan, and olives. I indulged in the hamburger and I am glad that I did, along with fabulous fries. I will return again and they will eventually get sick of me. Love this place.

Great food! I've been to Elysian a few times and can honestly say that whatever I order is better than what I had the last time! BLT is out of this world and they make killer Bloody Mary's. Awesome brunch spot but tends to get crowded!
Best brunch in hoboken. Who ever is in the kitchen has a talent for perfectly cooked bacon. The menu is simple but the food is top notch. Hot chocolate is quite literally a vat of melted chocolate.

I don't have much to add that hasn't already been said... the food is great and the building is beautiful (note the intricate, original ceiling!)I've been here for lunch before and just recently went with a group of 6 plus a baby.  The one glitch is that we'd made a reservation and the table wasn't quite ready yet so we had a few minutes of awkward shuffling around at the bar area while waiting.. the place gets PACKED for brunch!I ordered eggs florentine, one of my favorite brunch items.  It really was done perfectly.  They could go easy on the fries though-- my cup runneth over with frites, golden in perfection, yet many went to waste...I will definitely be back next time I'm in ol' Tow-boken!

The Elysian Cafe is just a beautiful place to look at with flowers and tables outside and Green adornments. Once inside it's just classically made and the windows bring in some nice light from the street. The service was quite quick and the host was very friendly.But such beauty is wasted when it comes to the bland food that is put in front of you. After the drinks came that we order, no bread or beginner was placed on our table. I ordered a steak au poivre medium rare and it came back almost well done. Ugh. Such a disappointment although the sauces and vegetables that came with it were decent.My wife ordered a seafood soup that maybe was a take off on a San Fran ciopinno but was bland again. Very, very under seasoned.  Maybe this passes for the bland clientele and the chef and owner don't want to offend palates but it really was disappointing but rung true the old cliche of judging a book by its cover.

My wife and I were big fans of the Elysian back when it first opened around a decade ago and we lived in Hoboken. We liked it because it was a comfortable place, with very good bistro options and a nice staff. Glad to see it hasn't changed.We dined their a few nights ago at one of their outdoor tables and had a great time. We lingered over a few extra rounds of drinks and never felt rushed by the staff.
Average american restaurant.Decent service. Dinner entrees low-to-mid 20s.Very, very loud and crowded.

I ordered the pepper crusted streak, it was overcooked, the mashed potatoes were dry and crumbly, and the green beans were tough, bland and cold.  Completely unacceptable for a $30 plate. The crab cake appetizer was pretty good though.

Visited here as an alternative to Anthony David's Gourmet. Very close proximity and what seems like additional seating. We were sat immediately by a lovely red-headed hostess in astoundingly tight jeans. (had to be said.) Even my female friend made a comment.We ordered french toast and a form of eggs benedict...which I'm determined to learn how to make.Food was ok, served quickly. But like ADG they didn't offer maple syrup. Why do nice places still serve crap corn syrup on their "gourmet" breakfasts. The orange juice was fresh-squeezed and the service overall was pretty good. (weirdly difficult to get butter served though...came in rock hard little butter packets..after sort of a snippy response from the server...very odd.) They should consider replacing their english muffins and maybe consider artisan breads at a little higher price, might be a nice touch.Sound does not get absorbed well here, so if there's kids...especially ones with crappy parents who have no idea how to discipline their children, it gets loud fast.

I've driven past Elysian many times and thought that it would be nice to sit outside on a 70 degree day and relax with some good drinks and food. Yesterday I finally tried it out. On the positive side, we (4 of us) were able to have that relaxing day and were not rushed at all. We drank some cocktails, finished those while we caught up with each other, then ordered some more cocktails and a few appetizers, and when those were done, another round and our entrees. It really was nice and relaxing, which is just what we were looking for in the atmosphere. Unfortunately, the food was remarkably bad. We ordered 18 oysters to start. While the flavor of the oysters was not bad, all (12) of the small kumamoto oysters had bits of chipped shell in them, rendering them impossible to slosh down or chew. Also they were $2.85 each which is pretty pricey. My entree was short ribs over saffron rice with a side of fries. Now when I eat unhealthy I'm consciously making the decision to satisfy my taste buds to the dismay of my waistline. What I hate is when both my waistline AND my tastebuds are unhappy. The meat had absolutely no flavor and way too much fat that hadn't rendered off. The fries were tasteless as well which is a shame at a brasserie-style restaurant. One of my companions had the steak frites (which i tried) and we both agreed that it was totally tasteless and overcooked. The cut of beef itself was very low quality, probably a select cut (below prime and choice). It was seasoned and cooked worse than your beginner home cook can do. Another companion who is a mussel aficionado thought her sauce/broth had no depth of flavor and was disappointed by the meager portion of actual mussels. On a side note, none of us had the lobster roll but we did spy our neighbor eating one. I am ALL ABOUT lobster rolls and it says something that I didn't order it after seeing hers. The roll looked weak and didn't seem like it could stand up to the filling. The lobster itself was more shredded and torn that I'd like. It really should be chunks of lobster with a light dab of homemade mayo. Now I hate being so negative and being a downer, but damn I'm just tellin it like it is!Now it's call out time! :) I have NO FREAKIN IDEA how you fellow yelpers give this place an average of 4 stars. If you're one who did and you also like places in town such as Grimaldi's or Leo's, may God have mercy on your tastebuds.

We wanted to like this place a lot, had seen all the good reviews and even tried to get in a couple of times but it was either booked or lined up.  Sadly on Memorial Day weekend we sat down at the inviting outdoor patio for what turned out to be a not so funny comedy of errors.  Maybe it was just a bad day but a great place should never have a day as bad as this.  The hostess seated us and it took at least 15 minutes before the waiter acknowledged us with a menu.  Drinks took forever.  2 of the items we wanted on the menu (one of them fries to go with a burger) we were told were unavailable.  The waiter didn't seem to care and stood around with other servers chatting while we waited..... and waited..... and waited.   Another couple were seated beside us and were served before our drinks came.   We were told the restaurant was unexpectedly busy and the kitchen was having problems keeping up.   We finally got up to leave in exasperation.   As we walked out the waiter ran after us down the street telling us our food had arrived.   Both sandwiches we ordered were poorly prepared and just OK.  To add insult to injury, as we sat waiting for almost an hour they charged us for a small refill of ice tea.  We had been looking forward to a very different experience and were disappointed.  Won't be going back anytime soon.

had i not read the reviews on yelp after visiting i wouldn't have known that this place was a "french bistro".  seemed like just a bar/restaurant to me.went there for lunch and had the burger.  i ordered it medium-rare and it was a solid medium-well.  disgusting.  one-and-done.

I can sum this up pretty quickly: DELICIOUS!This restaurant is not only adorable, but the food was terrific and fresh.The prices are incredibly reasonable, and the selection of appetizers and entrees will suit every palette.Stop reading this post, and just go already!

I agree with my bf in that the atmosphere and decor of the cafe were very charming. While I wasn't wowed by anything, the prices were all reasonable and they had a decent variety. The French onion soup was tasty, but  my fish and chips were pretty average. I would definitely go back and try a different dish. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The raspberry dessert wine was great!

I went to Elysian for brunch last weekend and loved the restored old-fashioned decor.  The moldings, antique light-fixtures and ancient wallpaper really add character to the homey atmosphere.  The service was decent, but nothing out of the ordinary.  I heard that this restaurant was owned by the same people behind Amanda's, which is less than a block away and has better food in my opinion.  Anyway, for brunch I ordered the Egg White Omelet with goat cheese, spinach, and tomatoes.  It came with a choice of roasted yukon potatoes or French fries and some fruit.  I chose the potatoes and enjoyed their flavor.  The omelet was also tasty, but a bit salty.  It was heavily packed with goat cheese.  We also ordered a plate of Cinnamon Amaretto French Toast for the table to share.  We all loved the sweet flavor, which made the entree more of a dessert than anything else.  The coffee here was also pretty strong and flavorful.Also, outdoor garden seating is available during warm weather.I definitely enjoyed Elysian, however I prefer brunch at Madison or Amanda's.  I need to try it for another course or for drinks to really decide.
Nice bar with beautiful ceilings. Lunch is ok, but a drink in the weekend or on the outside terrace is even better.

great cafe, they have a fantastic weekend brunch but plan on getting there 20 minutes early, there is always a line.  I recomend everything on the menue, I have never had any thing bad here. The only down side is that it is a little cramped inside. It is on the more expensive side as far as cafe's go, but it is worth every penny.

Definitely love the ambience, will have to try something other than the burger which was close to sub-par. great place to have brunch, sit outside and people watch. was not impressed with the bloody mary's either

Solid place for brunch, lunch, dinner, or drinks at the bar. The staff here is always friendly and welcoming. I haven't had a bad meal here either. They don't have a huge menu but there's definitely something for everyone, and the brunch menu is more adventurous than most Hoboken restaurants. I think my favorite thing about this place is the atmosphere. Maybe it's the green neon that does it for me, or maybe it's the high ceilings and beautiful architecture of the building. Either way, I'll be back for some Friday/Saturday live music and six point CRISP cans.

Had the pleasure of experiencing both lunch and dinner at the Elysian. The first time I went, I had the Calamari Salad. I don't know if the person below me had a different chef or the restaurant was just having an off day, but when I ordered it, it was not greasy. I thought it was well cooked, and they gave a generous amount of calamari compared to the majority of other restaurants I have ordered this from. My boyfriend had the Pastrami Sandwich. It was huge. He usually finishes my leftovers for me, but this sandwich filled him up, so much that he couldn't! The second time I went, I had the Mussels in White Wine and shared a pitcher of Sangria. These mussels are amazing particularly because the white wine broth is delicious. The Sangria was enough to fill 5-6 glasses for $20 which is a steal compared to the price in the city. Nothing to special about the sangria though. It was just nice to sip on with the meal and in between conversation.  Don't be fooled by the prices! Although it may seem to be one of those fancy restaurants where you still leave hungry, the portions are very generous. They have a separate menus for breakfast, lunch, dinner. Will definitely come here again when I'm in the area :) TIP: On Monday nights, they have a special where they remove the lowest priced bar menu item! Definitely take advantage of that if you live nearby!

This place has excellent food and the best ambiance of any bistro in Hoboken. My girlfriend and I love it. The staff has always been helpful and courteous, and the menu is very reasonably priced. Highly recommend it.

I had a great time at Elysian. Because of the split bar menu and entree menu, this is almost like 2 restaurants in one. I got a lox club sandwich with avocado, which was decent - but those dining with me ordered steaks that were delicious.  Bottles of wine as low as $25.

WARNING:New Chefmy 3 fav things on the menu calamari app, pulled pork, and chicken sandwich are different tasting now.  These 3 things are the only thing i ever order and the only reason i go there.  The calamari was superb, now it tastes fried and a weird oil is used.  The chicken sandwich bread is different and way too much sauce on it now.  Pulled pork was still good albeit the bread was different.  Such a shame to kill old standbys.

This is my go-to for lunch! The menu is simple and everything on it is prepared perfectly. The bread they use for their avocado blt really makes this a hit. Their french fries are the best in town. They do a smoked salmon club that is to die for and the french onion soup is great. The service is consistently good. Two thumbs up across the board.
love half priced Mondays. everything is good. it's a must do. the bartender however is douchey, I feel like he belongs in bushwick and hates his life for working in hoboken.

Well this was my 4th visit to Elysian, and my 1st review, I felt compelled to write, not to bash these guys, but more to give them a heads up. For months, I've been hearing from friends about Elysian's "AWESOME" burgers, I have had some nice meals in the past at Elysian, so my GF and I decided to cash in on Hoboken's ultimate burger. It was a fairly crowed Sunday afternoon, we sat right down, and ordered our meal, two cheese burgers please! Our burgers arrived in a timely manner, but both our burger buns were stale, and crumbly, and our frites? Limp and cold, I asked for another iced tea, it came without ice. I would have normally complained, if I weren't for a decent pickle, I don't think it fair to dismiss a restaurant when you've had some good meals in the past, but It was such a let down, I don't think I will be returning anytime soon, at least not for a burger.

One of my favorite places in Hoboken,  hands down. The food,  service and ambience are all top notch.All of the servers strike the perfect balance between professional and friendly. The manager with glasses and dark hair is super accommodating and always hustling. Doug the bartender is a great guy with awesome customer service skills. Can't beat the live music on Fridays or the absolute best outdoor cafe in town. Fries are to.die.for.

Had lunch at Elysian Cafe today...  We sat outside which was adorable and cozy!  I thought the food was good, I had the chicken Caesar salad and my daughter had the grilled chicken sandwich. Both were very taste and a nice sized portion however my husband ordered the "ham and cheese sandwich" which was $11.00 and it was tinyyyy!! Looked like a kids portion!! The service was "ehh" - our server had three tables (including ours) and she was so slow you would think he was taking care of 20 tables at once.  I want to like this place but every time I've come I've had issues with service.   I wish restaurant owners would understand how important training a staff  is.....
The food was good, the hostess was good, but the server was terrible. Didn't ask how our food was, or ask if we needed anything. I had an empty glass for 10 mins, and the waiter was MIA.
Tasty Pimm's Cup. The smoked salmon club comes w TONS of salmon. Service seemed a bit inattentive, despite it being pretty quiet and a Monday, but they were very nice and professional.

When I lived in Hoboken, Elysian was a favorite. It is decidedly not-Hobokenish (few aging frat boys, doesn't smell like beer) and has good food. It's not cheap, but it's a gorgeous place and has a lovely outdoor seating area. Their cocktails are creative and tasty.

Elysian Cafe is another one of my must go to spots in Hoboken - especially when it's nice out with outdoor seating!! The brunch is great and well-priced. I've been here for lunch a handful of times as well - I've never been disappointed! Although I've never tried it for dinner, it's next up on my list.The staff is very friendly, efficient, and always makes sure you are taken care of. the food is great and consistent - you'll always receive a plate with tasty food!!Additionally, I hosted a large lunch for my bridesmaids and they were great with setting aside a table indoors for us (so cute) and had an amazing time :)

Brunch Heaven, as long as you beat the crowd around 11:00 a.m. Despite of their unstable patio chairs and tables, I must say that the Elysian's menu is quite well-put-together..maybe because they have a cocktail special right in the bottom...almost in fine print...but if you are like me...you would either ask or request. Their cocktails are probably better than their food. Their screwdriver is made with fresh squeezed OJ, their Bloody Mary's are thick and nutrious (i think), and their Mimosas and Bellinis are just like everybody else's...OK.   Last weekend I ordered  Steak and Eggs with their Lyonnese potatoes (awesomisimo)..like I said...brunch heaven..period.
Nicest staff in town, great ambiance, delicious food, reasonable wine list. Always a pleasure.

One of the best spots in Hoboken,  been coming here for a long time... You have to try the Calamari and the Grilled Chicken Sandwhich with garlic fries... Brunch on Saturday or Beers outside after work, this place is great.  Its gets a little loud sometimes in the back room when there is a band, and a little crowed around the bar and the inside seats.  The Interior is real cool, and art deco, with the painted ceilings in the main area, as well as the blue lit white room in the back.

I went to the Elysian Cafe for breakfast or lunch, being a bit late for the former and a bit early for the latter.  I liked the look of the place, got a table under the tree and ordered their "1/2 sandwich with soup or salad".  I took the veggie sandwich -- delicious, and very big.  I would never have been able to eat a whole one.  Salad was plain but with a good dressing and a few cherry tomatoes.  This meal was exactly what I needed.  Wait staff was not very attentive, but polite.  Coffee was expensive ($2.50 for a cup).  All in all, the Elysian was a perfect fit for what I needed, and I would definitely go back.

A phenomenal French bistro right in Hoboken.  The decor is some of the coolest I've ever seen.  It really transports you across the Atlantic and back in time.We went for brunch but missed the cut off so had lunch instead.  I ordered the House-Cured Gravlax Club.  The fish was above average smoked salmon.  A satisfying but light sandwich on a warm day.  The frites are a cut above what you would get at most restaurants.  Thin, crispy, bistro style, and well seasoned.  I'd love to return for dinner because the menu looks great!

THE BEST! This lovely little cafe never disappoints me. The food has always been great and I always bring guests here when they visit Hoboken. In addition, the wait staff are always attentive and friendly.Do yourself a favor and go to Elysian. Their mussels with white sauce are delish!

I love this place! The desserts are incredible, awesome French fries, the meat entrees are tasty, and I love the caesar salad! The waiters are SOOOOO kind to you, and they don't get anything wrong. Everything is perfectly priced! The way the tables are set up is fancy, and unlike Ido sushi, the t.v.s are actually being used! Plus, instead of swords, they have cool baseball bats!

Went to visit a friend in Jersey and we decided on brunch here.  The wait wasn't too bad but I have to admit that the tables were too small and too wobbly and it was slightly crowded, and not in the quaint way.  The food, however, was delicious! I had eggs benedict with smoked salmon instead of ham and a bernaise sauce.  WOW.  My friend ended up getting the same thing and we devoured every bit.  Even though the dessert list was quite tempting, we could not fit another morsel into our mouths so we passed but I do suggest getting something off the dessert menu.  I would like to go back to try a few other things so we'll see when I can.

Food was really good, service was amazing, and prices were decent.  I will say though that the entree menu vs. the bar menu...the prices were drastically different.  I wound up ordering from the bar menu as it was much cheaper.  The server was amazing.  Very friendly, extremely attentive too.Overall, a great place...highly recommended.

My boyfriend and I stopped in after walking around in the rain a day or two after Christmas.  It was an off hour (3ish) and the bartender was kind enough to let us know to get our orders in ASAP if we wanted brunch.  We passed on the offer and proceeded to sit at the bar, drinking some type of a Christmas/winter brew.  ALL of them were quite tasty : )Can't wait to go back.  A very relaxing place.
Great food!!!! a little pricey, but worth it - good service also...had mussels and fish and chips...will be back

This may be my favorite restaurant in Hoboken.   It's the place where I go when I feel like going out for a relaxing dinner with my husband.  We like to sit in the bar area for a nice meal and a good glass of wine without breaking the bank.The food is delicious and they have a great wine list.  The atmosphere is lovely - warm, cozy, and stylish.  The service isn't amazing, but everyone is very nice, and they try very hard.I had my 40th birthday party in the back room with about 35 people and it was absolutely perfect and very reasonably priced.  I highly recommend this place for a private party.Here's a tip.  If you go on Monday they offer at 2 for 1 deal on the bar menu which has some of my favorite items on it.

My fiance and I love this place-even took our engagement pictures here.  The staff and previous manager have always been great and this was THE spot we loved to take out of town guests.  I brought my bridal party here for a Friday afternoon casual lunch and was told that seating would be at least 20 minutes to our group size.  We decided to wait in the shade off to the corner on the side of the outdoor seating area-the new manager quickly came over to us and said if we went any further from hearing distance our name would be dropped from the list and we would need to re-put our names back on the list and wait again.  After waiting for 30 minutes and seeing every other party not need to wait for a table- I went inside to speak to the manager and was shocked to see so many empty tables! The place inside was half full! She finally came up to speak with me from downstairs and told us it would still be a wait.  Finally we were seated-the food was great and the service from the waitress was also great.  I've read other reviews and it looks like this is a continuing problem here-Mr. Flinn please fix!!

My dinner here started out wonderful - we were sitting outside, had great salads.  It started to rain and we were moved inside which was fine.  But we finished our salads and waited another 35 minutes for our dinner which was on the appetizer menu.  Our waiter had changed and the new waitress was annoyed when we asked her who our new waitress was.  She told us with an attitude that everything, "was working" even though we came from outside and not to worry.  The hostess was very helpful and friendly although it did not help our food come out.  I thought of leaving and then asked for bread instead to hold us over.  The bread was unfortunately stale and we could not eat it.  When our appetizer finally came out after a total of 45 minutes waiting the mussels were ok - some were very fishy - some were better and the sauce was ok but no bread to dip.  The fries that came with the mussels were good.  The male staff was young but very nice and helpful, the female waitresses made us feel like crap and never checked in with us.  I'd like to try it again because it's so nice to sit outside here and the salads were great.  However, I like to eat where the staff is nice and friendly - it really makes all the difference.  Maybe we got our waitress on a bad day.

I went there with my fiancee and had 1 Draft Stella, 1 Urquell, 1 Finca Malbec, 1 Mussels, 1 Skirt Steak and a 1 Lobster Roll.The 2 Beers were excellent, very nicely chilled, the appetizer was also good, although have tried better at other restaurant around the neighborhood. My main dish which was the Skirt Steak was very nicely prepared and cooked to my preference.The main 2 reasons why we gave this a two star rating was because upon going to enjoy a nice Malbec from Argentina, I found a bug inside the Wine, mind you this was not a fruit fly, it was a small cockroach looking insect. Obviously I shared this with the waiter, and they quickly replaced the Wine but at no moment did they request to offer to take this off the bill. The money is not an issue here, but when something like this happens, you at least expect the manager come out an apologize and offer the Wine on the house. This wasn't done at all and it seemed like an everyday thing and I was wrong for having mentioned it.Secondly, my fiancees Lobster Roll came on a regular "wonder bread" , and accompanied by some  cold French Fries and a salad. She ate very little of that dish and left more than half.I see that most people have rated the Brunch really nicely, so please go enjoy this restaurant for Brunch, but be wary of ordering dinner and a Glass of Wine late night.

The service was infuriating. At it's most basic, this is a cute place with good food but brunch here was a disaster. Despite ample staff, the service was TERRIBLE! I did not get what I ordered and the waitstaff never returned to my table. I had to go ask the hostess for a refill on coffee, which she did but we had no milk so I had to get up again. If a restaurant is going to do brunch, it has to get the fundamentals right and Elysian Cafe did not get it right!1. Check with your customer to see if the food is right. 2. Send someone, anyone, around with coffee.
I came here for Sunday brunch. The food was excellent, the service was good and the decor clean and comfortable.
It's a lighter brunch than I was anticipating but the salmon eggs Benedict was sold me. The bloody Mary however was an incredible disappointment, as it was small and poorly mixed.

We go to Elysian Cafe to be cared for.  The service is so good, you never have to ask for water or menu or a drink.  You know the food is going to be just right.  You know Eugene chose great wines. We don't worry, we are just happy.

As far as pseudo-pricey meals go in Hoboken, this is not necessarily among my favorites. The food was good, but I've had better (of everything) elsewhere. We started with with 6 oysters (2 of each kind) and mussels in white wine sauce. Maybe we should have thought better than to order shellfish at a bar-ish type place-- neither was bad per se, but the oysters were lacking/slightly gritty and the mussels failed to impress. Bottom line: opt for different appetizers.I had a dirty grey goose martini which was mostly just vodka (fine by me, I guess), but not the best cocktail I've had either. As an entree, I had the Alaskan Cod Fillet w/ Sweet Corn Risotto, Parmesan Broth, & Roasted Red Peppers based on our server's recommendation. This actually was really delicious. The fish was well-cooked, as was the risotto. Despite including risotto, it did not sit heavy at all and was portioned just right. My boyfriend had a soft-shell crab sandwich they had as a special and he said it was good. I guess there isn't really anything wrong with this place, it just would not be the first place I'd recommend to a friend (Anthony David's is literally around the corner and is a better meal and date spot!).

Went for dinner last night and was very pleasantly surprised by the lovely decor.  We were seated in the back room and it was beautiful with all the moldings and tin ceiling.  Service was fine, prompt and courteous.  The food, however, was amazing.  Skirt steak and mushroom risotto were delicious.  Short ribs with veggies, saffron risotto, and then a side of mashed potatoes didn't last long.  And dessert . . . the Chocolate Grand Marnier Pot du Creme was incredible.  Prosecco and a nice Christmas Ale on tap were the perfect accompaniments.  I will definitely be back!

The Elysian Cafe is a great place to go.  I'd give it 5 stars if it weren't for two things: it gets ridiculously crowded and loud sometimes and its a little over priced for what you get.Unlike other bar/restaurants in the area, the food is really good; I think the quality is spot on - much more so than their sister restaurant: Amanda's.  But the food is a little pricey.  Of course, it is mostly bar food so comparing Amanda's to Elysian might not be the most fair but I've always found Elysian's food more savory than that of its fancier relative.My favorite dish there is the calamari.  A blend of arugula,sweet peppers, olives, tomatoes, and grated cheese, and calamari, it all just melts together in one harmonious flavor.  Its not a whole meal but it goes well with anything and everything they serve.  I also like their fries; there is something about them that tastes better than any other bar's.And of course, Elysian is a bar.  So you do have to deal with bar flies and those just watching the game on TV.  And as a result, you might not have a quiet night there.  But potential noise aside, you will enjoy the bistro-like decor.  And as a bar, I think the drink selection is good.  They have good beers, good spirits, and a friendly staff.I'd highly recommend Elysian.  If you don't mind a crowded or noisy scene (mostly on the weekends), this is your place for a slightly more upscale bar/restaurant that won't disappoint the taste buds.  Just be prepared to pay a slight premium for the good food.

Still as good as it gets.. since my previous review (and since moving uptown) I've found myself frequenting Elysian more and more. Never had a bad meal and the weekend brunch is superb. Professor W. wouldn't know a good meal if it jumped down his throat and Danielle D.. well.. go back to Lodi to hang out at your local TGIF. Seriously.And per a post on twitter I just saw.. Monday is 2-for-1 entrees. May need to confirm but that just solved my monday dinner dilemas for the summer.. giddy up.
Really beautiful decor, consistently friendly staff, and solid food.  Also, in the warmer months Elysian has a very lovely outdoor seating area.  Charming is the perfect word to describe the Elysian.
This place was super busy for weekend brunch. We waited for 20 mins for a table and then 30 mins for the food after ordering. I thought it was okay.
Came for lunch with a friend.  Cute little french bistro inside and out.  French onion soup was flavorful and I really liked the omelette with smoked salmon.

Cute bistro with nice decor. Came here with some friends for brunch. The weather was nice so we sat outside.  I ordered the french toast with strawberry sauce and fruit.  Overall it was okay.  The syrup was pretty rich but didn't really need to use it since the strawberry sauce was enough.  I think everybody enjoyed their meal but noone was extremely overwhelmed.  Had a cup of coffee and it came to about $15 including tax and tip.

I went for Sunday brunch and it was crowded! I'd defintiely suggest making a reservation.  We were a group of ten, and they accomodated all of us.  The food was great. I got the blueberry pancakes, sausage, and potatoes. It was all delicious and made just right. I also tried the snake bite Guinness/cider mix and it was delicious.  I never had such a perfect fall combo before.  Half of our party came over an hour and a half late and they still let us keep the table.  The waitress was obviously annoyed, but I couldn't blame her.  My only complaint about the place was that it was absolutely freezing! I took many trips to the bathroom just to run my hands under the hot water to warm up! I would definitely go back!

The Elsian Cafe is one of a few fully restored older addresses in Hoboken. Fully restored to it's pre-war turn of the centyry glory, it is beautiful not only to look at but it is worth it for a fresh French style Bistro. The menu is small but varies from Mussels & Pommes Frites in a White Wine-Garlic broth to Warm Roast Beef 'Au Poivre'. An appropriate Beer selection to go along with the eats, and outdoor seating, make this cafe a stand out. I wish other restaurants in Hoboken would put forward such a complete effort as this. Nice!

My wife and I went there on a Wednesday nightLet us start with the food. We split a grilled chicken sandwich and a bucked of garlic fries. The food was excellent. Good Wine too.The service seemed a bit indifferent at first but the food and drinks came out quick enough. They left a bottle of water at our table which I liked but someone kept coming back to refill my glass which was not really required. Maybe I am just being over-critical. They could definitely do better in the service dept. is what I though.We arrived a bit late (around 9:30 ish) and would have loved to be seated outside but the server politely told us that Hoboken had some strict curfew hours for outside seating. I would have enjoyed my meal more if we sat outside just because it was a nice evening. Yet when we left there were people sitting outside and enjoying their meal. Go figure!

The best place for brunch in Hoboken! I recommend the strawberry french toast with a pot of hot chocolate (when in season). My favorite restaurant in hoboken, period. The place itself is immaculate, with a friendly wait staff and plenty of indoor/outdoor seating. If you go anywhere in hoboken, make it elysian.

my favorite brunch place in the area. I love the little sidewalk tables and the mimosas are cheap and delicious... doesnt get better than that. The lardon salad is gooey and dressed just right. While I have been there for dinner, the menu didnt wow me. ps. i love bartenders with long moustaches!

Came here for a last-minute birthday dinner on a Saturday night. We were able to get a table for two in about 15 minutes. The food was phenominal. We shared the duck confit as an appetizer. It was cooked to perfection. I had the lobster roll, which was also delicious. It had nice big pieces of lobster and was nicely complemented with the toast. I also had the creme brulee for desert, which had a perfect crust on top. Let's not forget the wine - their cote du rhone was fantastic! Everything was amazing. It far exceeded our expectations and may very well be our new favorite place in Hoboken!

I 've been to this place many times and the reason I go is because it is a really nice looking bar/restaurant. I'm a hugh fan of the decor and the mood in this place. The food is ok nothing to rave about but the look of this place is worth the visit even if you just go to share a bottle of wine and catch up with your friend I suggest you go. The staff is really nice and if you do find yourself wanting to eat something try the pork chop seared without demi glaze with pomme frites.

Almost 9 months ago now, one of my best friends moved out to Hoboken, NJ.  Three of us girls got together for a mini-reunion lately and as is tradition, we pigged out together at Sunday brunch.  Yummm.Three refreshing belinis, two svaory benedicts, one egg-white omelette, and a decadent order of french toast later - mind you our plates were clean - the waiter brings over the check, friendly grin on his face, and has written the following note on the back: drinks are on me because you girls are so cute AND so hungry.  We were totally flattered and completely full - and it just spoke to the friendliness of this place.I left Elysian Cafe with a new appreciation for Hoboken, NJ.  1. So many of the buildings in NJ are just beautiful and charming - tinned ceilings, exposed brick, sense of history.2. SF guys could learn a thing or two from Hoboken folks - they're straightforward AND friendly3. I like this getting bought drinks for our ability to eat thing.

I really enjoy Elysian. Really pretty outdoor cafe (dog friendly), amazing french fries and very good wines. On Friday nights there is often really good live music (mostly covers of Bruce, Van Morrison, etc - which I love) and it gets busy at the bar. Tasty food, solid service and charming atmosphere. I'm a fan!
Went for Brunch and it was quite good. Hot chocolate was rich but a little Luke warm. Blueberry pancakes were delicious! Nice atmosphere
Worst food by a long way. Went on Xmas eve... Seemed the food was from last Xmas eve !!! Bread was rock hard, spinach was old, glasses were not properly cleaned even!!!! Never again !!!
Not a destination spot but a good neighborhood option. Great outdoor seating in the summer. Solid (except crispy pork - tastes like an overcooked french fry) but not great food. Nice service

The food was not bad especially, the pomme frites, however the service was poor seems our waitress abandoned us and after complaining someone else took over who was ok but still a cool service meal was slapped on the table , unable to get coffee refill steak sauce or even butter for toast even after asking repeatedly

We tried Elysian Cafe last night and were quite impressed.  We ate outside on a hot night, but the breeze on Washington made it tolerable.  Not particularly hungry, we went with the sirloin salad and sandwiches, which were very good.  The frites were fantastic!  The wine list is fairly short, but features good bottles at reasonable prices.  They were out of the Cotes-du-Rhone, but the $30 Finca Malbec was excellent.  We'll definitely go back to try the menu's full entrees (the Tuesday-special lamb shank looked especially inviting).  With further positive experience, an even higher rating may be justified.

Elysian Cafe gave me a good impression of Hoboken on my first journey across the river for brunch.  The service was great and the food was delivered very quickly.  I had a good grilled chicken sandwich, but the pommes frites were the highlight.  The ingredients were fresh (imagine good, ripe avocado on the east coast in November!) and the meal attractively presented.I was with a friend who commented that the menu was filled with items that looked just like what she saw while living studying abroad in Provence.I won't be making any trips to Hoboken just to go to this French Bistro, but when the occasion arises, I'll certainly consider going back.

Definetely was expecting more from this place. The website/ menu looks incredible with a variety of options but its definetely small and not much to choose from. Environment feels tight and youre sitting on top of other tables.  Food was good, a little pricy though.  on my next trip to Hoboken I will not consider going here. Many other places to choose from.
