Best bar/restaurant in Hoboken. Every bartender is great and the food is superb. It's very popular, so try to get there early on weekend nights. Also, the Hoboken baby brigade has taken over it, so there are times when bad parents and bratty children can be disruptive- but honestly it is a rarity. Good civil crowd, nice blend of older and young folks with few meatheads or Jersey Shore show extras. Solid music too, with a god yet diverse play list every night. They have a good wine list and some great specials too. The outdoor seating is tight yet, comfortable. The wait staff is professional and well managed. It's one of the few places in Hoboken that is a must. The decor is fantastic.

We had just finished an amazing dinner nearby and the restaurant suggested this place.  I can say that never in my life have I ever experienced more DISPICABLE service than at this place.  I would NEVER EVER recommend this place to anyone, and for members of YELP, AVOID AVOID AVOID.  I can't believe the ratings, especially the comment "great place to sit with friends and chat"...b/c that is basically what we were doing and the bartender pretty much said if we didn't order  more alcohol, other ppl needed our seats.  How f'd up is that.  It was not even busy.

My GF and i had our baby shower here and I was absolutely impressed by the space and the staff.  What a fantastic old school atmosphere to celebrate an important event.  The bloody marys were good and the burger was even better.

Have eaten here w by bf twice; once outside when it was extremely chilly and we were not dressed seasonably appropriately thus putting a huge damper in the evening. The second time we went it was on valentines day and we ate inside, which made a huge difference. The feel of the interior is very authentic with a stylish ornate tin ceiling and lightly colored walls to keep the bright and airy. From the moment you walk in, you feel as though you are walking into a genuine French bistro.Being valentines day we ordered from the limited menu, which was varied just enough to pls anyone's tastes. I can't remember what I ordered but I do know that being huge oyster fans, my bf and I went to town ordering blue points and they were fantstic. This is a great historic French bistro that is also conveniently located around the corner from my bfs apt. I will absolutely frequent this place more, if not for the food than for the authentic bistro feel and the oysters
Delicious brunch.  Everything from the burgers to the poached eggs are good.  Wish the mimosas were a tad bigger... ;)

Food is consistently very good at dinner.   The braised short ribs and tehr brined pork chops were both much better than expected for $25.  I am a big fan of the crisp calamari salad with peppers and olives and arugula.   Its a good starter for 2 or an entree.   We also had a cote du rhone for $25 that was a good value.   The food was a little slow but they were short a waiter.Hard to go wrong unless you are looking for bar snack or appetizers.  The selection of both is pretty bad.

So I have been here for brunches, lunches and dinners and each time the food was great, but not exciting. There is nothing on the menu that jumps out at me and its a very small menu so I am not always excited to go back for the same boring experience. The decor is elaborate, I especially love the ornate ceiling!

Don't add on protein to your Salad!!! It's Overpriced. I ordered a salad and was encouraged to add on shrimp or chicken. I chose shrimp and wasn't very satisfied with the quality, it was rubbery. It would have been a better salad without the shrimp. Then I got the bill and realized that the shrimp was $10. I would have sent it back if I knew that. Who charges $10 for shrimp on a $9 salad?

Had a very nice experience here. More expensive than a diner for brunch but not insane. Anthony David's is crazy for brunch. Service was very good. Portions could've been a little bigger but taste and presentation made up for lack of gigantic diner size. Beautifully maintained antique relief ceiling. Charming.

Great place for brunch. Had a large group, they were exceptionally accommodating. The food came quickly, the mimosas and bellinis were just right. I am not sure how the wait is but we had more than 6 and made a reservation and it was great! Key lime pie was very good as well. Decor is lovely, very pleasant place. Will definitely go back.
My favorite place to go for a Pimm's cocktail and mussels! Awesome food, great service too!

I've been there twice for brunch and and have mixed feelings about this place. On the plus side, when eating inside, the decor is very classic, the art and renaissance style architecture are attractive. I also ate outside, on a beautiful Sunday around noon- another plus was that there was surprisingly no wait for a table- and enjoyed the people watching and nice weather.That being said, the food was "eh." The eggs benedict was standard, nothing to set it apart. On each occasion, someone ordered an omelette and on each occasion, no one raved nor cried foul...although it looked as if it was a two-egg portion... a bit petit for me at brunch. The drinks were all half price, a nice treat and the bloody mary was better than average.all in all, i go for the atmosphere and the fact its a block from my house, but unlike others who rave about this place....its not worth a special trip.

Went here for lunch with my mom when I first was looking for an apartment in NJ.  We had lunch here and it was great.  Siting outside on Washington was super cool and the food was good too.  Some solid sandwiches here so check it out!

Great french fare, and a really good and inexpensive wine list. Their outdoor brunch in the summer is nice, but I particularly like the back room with its classic brownstone decor (tin ceilings!). I've eaten here many times, the hanger steak on risotto is my personal favorite. When I had to organize a conference dinner for 25 they were very accommodating, even though we were below the threshold to have the whole backroom to ourselves. For groups they have a great prix fixe menu with choices for vegetarians and for us they picked some very nice wines, even though the whole affair came in under budget. Highly recommended.

All the bartenders at this place have a bad attitude.... I've come here 5 times.... Sat at bar.... I feel like I am bothering them....really bad attitudes.... One bartender wanted me to close out because he was finishing his shift...no thank you...no asking if there was anything else i needed....pretentious and stuck up!! Great food otherwise... Sit at tables....not bar... You will have a better time
Ordered Croque Monsieur, I tasted Gruel cheese but I didn't taste bechamel sauce.  So it was basically grilled cheese with ham..

I've only been here once but the burger was juicy and flavorful and I couldn't stop eating their fries! Great service, good beer... it's a great place to go on a date or hang out with friends. I definitely look forward to dining here again. Once it gets warm, it would be great to enjoy their outdoor seating.

This French cafe has good food and a small, but relaxed and nice outdoor section in the front which is great in the summer time. Like "real" French restaurants, the water is served mildly cool with no ice. Their lobster roll is good. The back room is often has its heat set too high in the winter time so dress lightly and simply wear a heavy jacket there.

A favorite spot in hoboken.  Homey atmosphere at the bar that makes you want to stay a while.  The perfect local.  Really enjoy the live music on the weekends as well.  As for food, plenty of great items on the menu but the burger is worth an extra mention - really really good!  I love this place.
One of my favorite places in Hoboken. Cute little place, great food (especially the mussels), great drinks, good prices.

I've definitely had better.  I had high expectations since this place is always packed.  First, the menu wasn't that exciting.  My coffee was lukewarm and my food was mediocre (fries weren't hot and had little taste).  The tables were small so I didn't even really enjoy the atmosphere.  Very disappointed...there has to be better brunch in Hoboken.

I have eaten here about 7 times. Most experiences have been above average. The Steak Frites is nice. The Burger is very good. The Chicken Sandwich w/ avocado is off the hook. Brunch is very solid. But my recent dinner was extremely disappointing. We started with a salad, which was fine, but the $28 lamb chops were awful. I ordered them medium, and they came rare. Had to send them back. The marinade was terrible - waaaay to heavy on the mustard. You could not even taste the meat, it was all mustard. Very tart and i'm afraid it just ruined the dish. I will stick with the sandwiches at Elysian Cafe. I do like the atmosphere of the place, and will continue to dine here.
bad service, friendly but clueless, nice interior decor, burger/sandwiches average nothing creative or super quality, bread was stale,  crowded at nights.  it's OK.

adored this place...a wonderful find as we are tripping all over Hoboken  having just arrived to live here and found this  Cafe  this evening to find  charm out doors and authenticity indoors..... Not sure about the tv screens but that seesm to the thing here ? Bright menu and refined presentation.... The Spanish Cava was a perfect aperitif .... We are from Belgium and terribly spoilt  with cafe life and likes  but we agree this darling little treasure would fit right into Gent or Antwerpen in the blink of an eye or ogenblik as the Flemish say.... This place is to be our place to eat  out ourselves and bring friends to. Thank goodness for  small foodie find  al la Elysian... The  wait staff are super too... excellence this side of the Hudson.......maybe the Pond also!

Consistent. Friendly waitstaff/bartender.  Gets very crowed great neighborhood bar.  Only complaint is their pizza which is good is VERY greasy. A higher quality cheese w/ more milk less oil will fix that. Over all good.

Food here is generally very good and priced well for Hoboken. Brunch here is over hyped. There simply is not enough waiters for the Sunday crowd with kids and dogs outside. Then again I'm not a big brunch fan to begin with.

What a gorgeous building! My friend & I met here with our kids last spring, and it was a great spot to brunch. We sat outside (perfect for dropped crumbs) and had a leisurely meal. My pancakes with blueberries were delish; the French fries that came with my friend's sandwich were nice and crispy. The waitress was nice and understanding (always a plus).  Except for the bird pooping on my son's cushion--ah, the perils of outdoor eating!-- we had a great time.  If it was closer to the PATH (and maybe that's a good thing for the locals), I'd probably make this a regular meeting spot.

came here for sunday brunch and was not disappointed. mimosas, yum! cinnamon french toast w strawberry drizzle, yum! the service was great and there was a really good crowd in there, partaking in the weekend ritual. i hear it's just as good for lunch and dinner so i'm looking forward to trying another meal there in the near future. my only brunch complaint? pulp-free OJ please!!!
Love the ambiance and vibe. Bar is excellent. Clean taps and great service. Service impeccable and they make you feel like family.

This is my favorite spot in Hoboken.  I'm here at least once every other week.  It has a great variety of food and appetizers (great bar food and nice entrees), and everything is consistently cooked to perfection.  They really care about their customers as well.  The service is great!

Late 1800s establishment.  Has gorgeous fabric walls and the floor has a darling patio tile.  Food is affordable, yet high quality.  The eggs especially are delicious, as are the eggs florentine.  Great place to eat brunch.

This restaurant gets 3 stars from me, because up until recently they have had okay food, and pretty good service. However, I recently made a reservation for 8 people because I had family in town visiting. When we arrived I was told that I had not made a reservation (incorrect!). They tried to seat us at 3 bar tables (each fits 2 people) in the crowded bar area. I explained that we all wanted to sit together, hence my reservation for 8 people. They suggested that we wait outside and asked us if we would like a bottle of wine while we waiting for a table in the restaurant. (it was 90* outside mind you, and no standing room inside) An hour later a table was available. A few of our orders were wrong (which normally doesn't bother me that much). However, when the bill came the bottle of wine we were offered was added to our bill. When I mentioned this to the manager he was incredibly rude and stated that we could have sat at the 3 bar tables, and therefore it was "our choice" to wait, and anything we drank while we waiting was also our choice to add to our bill. No apology and no discount or bottle of wine. I was not impressed with the service OR response by the manager. A simple sorry goes a long way. I will not be returning to The Elysian...

Not terribly impressed with Elysian. This place is also a "sister" restaurant of Amanda's in Hoboken, which i am much more please with. I went to Elysian during lunch hours and also this past Mothers Day. The wait was about 30-40 minutes for first available seating. After the long wait, we were seating in the outdoor section. The chairs outside are basically patio furniture, without the soft cushion. You will be sitting on very hard aluminum chairs if you decide to dine outside. Now for the food: I decided to order what I thought would be a steak omelette; traditionally strips of steak with eggs. Instead, the meal was presented as scrambled eggs with a big, thick chunk of steak on the side. Good luck cutting and tearing into this tough chunk of meat. There was nothing tender about it, and was actually rather laborious to even eat. Portions are usually small at this place, but that of course depends on what you're ordering. It's really not bad if you are going for a salad or something light. Don't expect to pay less than 15 bucks for a salad at this place.
Extremely tasteful...the food was good and so were the drinks...if parking was better I would go more often.  Really nice spot in the summer.
Over-priced, average French bistro fare. I've never had a meal here that I've loved, and the food is consistently meh. But the divine Guiness is a good deal at $8.
Sitting outside for brunch is so nice and they have great service!

Nice place for brunch. I came here yesterday afternoon for brunch, I was happy that we got a place to sit outside, nice and relaxing afternoon.  People watching is always great. The food was pretty decent too I had the eggs Benedict, not great, but it got the job done.

My favorite place for a Friday night dinner or Sunday Brunch in Hoboken. There's a lively bar scene in the front but unlike most places in the area the customers are (or at least behave like) grownups. It's a great room. I think it may be the oldest continuously operating dining room in Hoboken. To me the atmosphere is truly that of a neighborhood Bistro. For that matter the menu is mainly Bistro classics...all well executed and consistent time after time. My guilty pleasure here is the Garlic Fries: really good Frites tossed in a garlic butter with Parmigiano. Nice.
